text:
*How can we improve our API status reporting?*
If you have a few minutes, we would love to hear your thoughts.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/survey/api-status-2019>
Can someone refresh my memory... in the CMS API, what is the difference between `templates` and `layouts`?
Looks like maybe `layouts` are only DnD templates, whereas `templates` are those and custom coded templates?
So a `layout` is drag and drop “template”
`template` is a hard-coded template
A layout has an associated template with it that is generated every time the layout is updated
So `layout` -> `template` -> `page`, or you can skip the layout stage by creating a hardcoded template yourself
Ahhh, I see... so what appears to be the same layout that's returned in templates, is actually a template generated from the layout?
(And the ID's are different as well, so that makes sense)
When you get a `layout` from the API you can see there is a `generatedTemplateId`
Which you can use with the `template` API to get the HTML
Thaaank you, that makes much more sense now.
The `layout` there is to just store the layout data like the rows and which modules are in which rows, etc.
cc <@U7SL518D6> <@U2H3TT8F2> perhaps we can make this clearer in the documentation
In terms of what we see in local dev (the .json file), is that the layout file?
Looks like that json file is part of the layout... So next question is, are the generated templates visible anywhere in local dev, or only accessible through the API?

Just to clarify, does the warning about confidential files from this doc still apply to files uploaded with the `hidden: true` parameter? That’s basically what the UI does for deal attachments, right? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/files/post_files>
The warning still applies. The hidden parameter determines if the file will show up in the portal’s file manager, but regardless of what the hidden value is set to, it will be publicly available
So any file we attach to a Deal via the UI is publicly available?
Internally we have controls that allow us to make files non-public (for example deals attachments), but we do not currently expose this functionality for developers
Are custom CRM properties for Products and Line Items exposed anywhere in the UI? Was testing them out, but they don’t seem to show up in the Product Library or when adding Products to a Deal
